sledgehammer.command

Class CommandHandlerContainer

  • java.lang.Object
    • sledgehammer.command.CommandHandlerContainer

  • public class CommandHandlerContainer
extends java.lang.Object
    CommandHandlerContainer is a container class for the CommandHandler Annotation. This is to help cache and handle data and operations for command handlers in Sledgehammer. The method of invocation is through the MethodHandle API introduced in the JDK 1.7 version in order to handle methodical invocation that pre-compiles the data required to execute the method using the traditional reflection API, allowing the execution of the command handler to execute with the least amount of computations possible in the JVM.

    Command handlers must contain one parameter for the method, which is the command being interpreted and handled. If the parameters are not setup to only have the command being handled and the response object, the container will not be enabled. The handler will still be registered for debugging purposes.

    An example command handler is as follows:

    CommandHandler(ignoreCancelled = true, priority = 5) private void on(Command command, Response response) { // Handle Command here. }

    Author:
    Jab

    • Constructor Detail

      • CommandHandlerContainer

        public CommandHandlerContainer(Listener container,
                               java.lang.reflect.Method method,
                               CommandHandler annotation)
        Main constructor.
        Parameters:
        container - The Object to identify with the command handler. This is typically the declaring class.
        method - The Method that is the command handler to invoke.
        annotation - The command handler annotation that contains the information important to the functions of the command handler.

    • Method Detail

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object

      • handleCommand

        public void handleCommand(Command command,
                          Response response)
                   throws java.lang.Throwable
        Handles a command. If the command handler is not enabled, then we return without attempting to handle the command.
        Parameters:
        command - The command to handle.
        response - The response to set.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Throwable - Thrown if the command handler fails to handle the command, or the method handle fails to invoke the method.

      • getMethod

        public java.lang.reflect.Method getMethod()
        Returns:
        Returns the method that is the command handler being invoked when handling commands.

      • getAnnotation

        public CommandHandler getAnnotation()
        Returns:
        Returns the annotation instance storing the metadata for the command handler.

      • getContainer

        public Listener getContainer()
        Returns:
        Returns the container for the method to invoke.

      • getPriority

        public int getPriority()
        Returns:
        Returns the priority index for the command handler. The higher the number, the more priority the command handler has over other command handler, and will be invoked first.

      • ignoreHandled

        public boolean ignoreHandled()
        Returns:
        Returns true if the command handler handles the command, even if the command is cancelled by a prior command handler.

      • getId

        public java.lang.String getId()
        Returns:
        Returns the string ID (if defined), for the command handler.

      • isStatic

        public boolean isStatic()
        Returns:
        Returns true if the command handler is declared as a static method.

      • getMethodParameters

        public java.lang.Object[] getMethodParameters()
        Returns:
        Returns the parameters for the method.

      • isEnabled

        public boolean isEnabled()
        Returns:
        Returns true if the command handler is enabled. When this is disabled, commands will not be passed and handled.

      • setEnabled

        public void setEnabled(boolean flag)
        Sets the command handler as enabled. When this is disabled, commands will not be passed and handled.
        Parameters:
        flag - The status to set.

      • getTimeCreated

        public long getTimeCreated()
        Returns:
        Returns the UNIX timestamp for the container to identify when the container is created.

      • getCommands

        public java.lang.String[] getCommands()
